Dear Megan Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth J was kissed and touched by a peer implying inadequate
staff supervision.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 4/2/24.
I notified Youth J’s Foster Care Worker of the assigned
investigation. She had no licensing concerns pertaining to Vista
Maria.
I interviewed Youth J on 4/3/24 with Rights Officer present. She
has been at Vista Maria for four months. Youth J said Youth D
has touched her thighs under the table in the conference room
attached to A-wing on an unknown date. She said Staff 1 was
supervising but could not see under the table. Youth J said Youth
D also touched her “boobs” several times on the couch in the
general living area. Various staff were always supervising on
different unknown dates and times when this occurred. Youth J
said, “Youth D was sneaky” and that she would cover up with a
jacket so the activity could not be detected.
More recently Youth J said she and Youth D planned to meet
inside the wing bathroom. “I suggested the bathroom where
there’s no cameras,” she announced. “I was in the first stall and
Youth D came in. We kissed. She tried to give me a hickey on
my boob. It’s not there anymore.” Apparently, Youth J informed
someone that this happened, and Youth J was transferred to a
different wing on 3/25/24.
I interviewed Youth D on 4/3/24 with Rights Officer present. She
said she has been at the facility for two months. Youth D said
Youth J “grabbed my hand and made me touch her thigh” under

the table in the conference room where staff can’t see.” Youth D
said staff were in the room supervising but she was unsure which
staff it was. Asked if she touched Youth J inappropriately on the
couch in the general area, Youth J insisted, “No. No. No.” In
terms of the girls kissing in the bathroom, Youth D said Youth J
“set that up. She put the shower on and then went into the first
stall. I went in behind her. She wanted to kiss me. I didn’t want to
kiss her or meet her in the bathroom. I was forced.” Youth D said
Staff 2 was supervising the girls outside the bathroom. Staff 2 let
Youth D use the bathroom because she thought Youth J was in
the shower. “We are on a separation plan.”
I interviewed Staff 1 via Teams on 4/10/24 with Rights Officer
present. She has worked at the facility part-time for two years.
Staff 1 stated she sometimes monitors youth at a table in the
conference room, but never saw or heard that Youth J or Youth D
touched each other’s legs under the table. If youths sit too close
to one another, she said she asks them to move further away and
the same goes for when they are sitting on the couch. Staff 1 did
not monitor the youths in the bathroom, but explained two youths
are allowed to be in there together if they use two different stalls
or one is in the toilet and the other in the shower stall.
I interviewed Staff 2 via phone on 4/10/24 with Rights Officer
present. She has worked at the facility for seven months. Staff 2
denied seeing or suspecting Youth J and Youth D ever touched or
kissed. She recalled the day the two youths asked to use the
bathroom. Youth J was in the bathroom and Staff 2 called out to
her asking if she was in the shower. Youth J responded, “Yes.”
After that Youth D asked to use the toilet and went into a toilet
stall while Staff 2 stood at the doorway of the bathroom. Staff 2
said she stood there until Youth D exited the bathroom. A few
days later “Youth J told me she had lied to me about something in
the bathroom, but she would not say what she lied about.”
Afterward this Youth J was moved to a different wing.
Document reviewed:
Back to Basics – Guidelines, Expectations and Campus-Wide
Rules for Vista Maria Unit Staff which indicates staff must maintain
a position inside the bathroom if two or more clients are present.
Analysis Both girls admitted they touched under a table and planned to
meet in the bathroom and kiss. Both girls claimed the other forced
them to touch and kiss. The youths said a thigh was touched
under a table where staff could not see their hands. In the
bathroom, one turned on the shower pretending to shower, but

she was actually in a toilet stall. The other youth went inside the
same toilet stall and the youths kissed. Staff 2 was supervising at
the doorway of the bathroom, but Vista Maria’s guideline indicates
staff must position themself inside the bathroom if two or more
clients are present. Staff 2 did not follow the written guideline.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: The investigation substantiated that inappropriate physical contact, including kissing and touching, occurred between two residents, Youth J and Youth D, at the Vista Maria facility. The incidents happened due to lapses in supervision, including staff not being able to see under a table and, critically, a staff member (Staff 2) failing to follow the facility's own written policy by not positioning herself inside the bathroom while two residents were present. The facility is ultimately culpable for the violation due to its staff's failure to adhere to established supervision protocols.
